page.title: 05Natural Amenities Group
page.content: This group was formed in 1983 when it was felt by some villagers of Lytchett Matravers that the whole area was under{pressure from developers.}It was the wish of many inhabitants to retain the{green belt}area. A ring of{horse chestnut trees,} probably 200 years old were felled just north of the church. Woodlands were sold and{tree preservation orders had to be confirmed. Two small{ponds}were in danger of being filled in, although the one at Rats Castle appears to have been reprieved. The group continues to maintain vigilance.
